title: Port wine stencils
content:
Hello all!

Can anyone identify this stencils typefaces? Thanks a lot!!!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Stencil%20fonts_6134.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/oporto-29_3562.jpg)

Font: 

 P22 PoP Art Stencil and LeCorbusier 

Solved By: 

 [donshottype](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403/http:/typophile.com/user/205259 "View user profile.")
author: Calabaça

comments.content:
Somewhat similar effect with the modern digital stencil fonts LeCorbusier

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LeCorbusierAsVINTAGE1913478_6481.gif)
  
 [http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Le+Corbusier/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Le+Corbusier/ "http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Headline+Fonts/Le+Corbusier/") and P22 PoP Art Stencil  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/p22PoPArtStencilAsVINTAGE1913478_6170.png)
  
 [http://www.fonts.com/font/p22/p22-pop-art/stencil?SiteId=15](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403/http:/www.fonts.com/font/p22/p22-pop-art/stencil?SiteId=15 "http://www.fonts.com/font/p22/p22-pop-art/stencil?SiteId=15")  
Don

I did not find anything closer than Le Corbusier. some other substitutes are at [http://www.identifont.com/find?font=stencil&q=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=stencil&q=Go "http://www.identifont.com/find?font=stencil&q=Go")  
Don

Another in the same vein: French Stencil JNL

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403im_/http:/typophile.com/files/FrenchStencilJNLNumbers_3469.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/french-stencil/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/french-stencil/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/jnlevine/french-stencil/")  
Don

You could be interested in some of the suggestions in this old thread: [http://typophile.com/node/71771](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403/http:/typophile.com/node/71771 "http://typophile.com/node/71771")
Thanks a lot for your quick answers!!! P22 PoP Art Stencil and LeCorbusier look like they can work for the project that i’m working on.

Big collection of stencils, but none closer than the Corbusier/Bodoni variations already mentioned, i.e. Le Corbusier, PoP Art Stencil, Jenneret, and French Stencil [http://www.fontspring.com/classification/Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317090403/http:/www.fontspring.com/classification/Stencil "http://www.fontspring.com/classification/Stencil")  
Don
